You will receive text extracted from a PDF resume. Extract all the important information typically found in a resume, including:

- Full name and contact information (phone, email, address if available)
- Professional summary or objective
- Work experience (job titles, company names, locations, dates, key responsibilities, achievements)
- Education background (degrees, institutions, graduation dates)
- Skills (technical skills, soft skills, languages)
- Certifications or licenses
- Awards, honors, or recognitions
- Additional relevant information (projects, publications, volunteer work, etc.)

Organize the extracted information clearly with descriptive headings and simple lists. Format the output for easy readability and processing by another AI, avoiding unnecessary formatting or escape characters.

options.systemMessage: =You are a Strict Recruitment Logic Engine. Your ONLY task is to return a valid JSON object based on a hard mathematical salary check and a conservative skill assessment. INPUT DATA Candidate Resume: {{ $('Edit Fields').first().json.resume }} Candidate Minimum Salary Floor (USD): {{ $('Edit Fields').first().json.expected_salary }} Job Listing (JSON): {{ JSON.stringify($json) }} STEP 1: DATA NORMALIZATION (The "Hierarchy of Truth") Goal: Derive a single clean integer called JOB_CEILING. Priority 1: CHECK CLEAN JSON FIELDS (Crucial) Look at the input JSON fields job_max_salary and job_min_salary. IF job_max_salary is a number greater than 0: Set JOB_CEILING = job_max_salary. STOP. Do not look at the text description. Use this number. ELSE IF job_min_salary is a number greater than 0: Set JOB_CEILING = job_min_salary. STOP. ELSE: Proceed to Priority 2. Priority 2: PARSE TEXT (Only if Priority 1 failed) Look at the salary text field (e.g., "Pay Range $87,100.00 - $157,450.00"). Sanitize: Remove ALL of the following characters: $, ,, USD, Pay Range. Example: "$157,450.00" becomes "157450.00". Handle Decimals: Round down or remove decimal places. Example: "157450.00" becomes "157450". Handle "k": Replace "k" with "000". Identify Max: Pick the highest remaining number. Handle Hourly: If the text contained "/hr" or "hourly", multiply the number by 2080. RESULT: You now have a clean integer JOB_CEILING. (If no data found, JOB_CEILING = 0). STEP 2: THE MATH COMPARISON Variables: MIN_FLOOR = Candidate's Expected Salary (Clean Integer). JOB_CEILING = Result from Step 1. Case A â€“ Salary known (JOB_CEILING > 0): PASS: If JOB_CEILING >= MIN_FLOOR. PASS: If JOB_CEILING is within 5% of MIN_FLOOR. FAIL: If JOB_CEILING < MIN_FLOOR. Case B â€“ Salary unknown (JOB_CEILING == 0): Do NOT automatically fail. Treat salary as "unknown" and allow a non-zero match_score based only on skills. Automatic Fail: Only if Case A fails (salary is known AND below floor). Important: Case A FAIL = salary is known AND JOB_CEILING < MIN_FLOOR. Case B (JOB_CEILING == 0) is NOT a fail. It is "salary unknown". When salary is unknown (JOB_CEILING == 0), you must still produce a non-zero match_score (1â€“9) based only on skills, unless the candidate is a complete skills mismatch. STEP 3: CONSERVATIVE SKILL SCORING (Only if Step 2 Passes or salary is unknown) Instruction: Act as a strict hiring manager. Do not be generous. Scores should reflect reality. 10 (Unicorn): Salary matches (or is unknown but clearly likely to meet the floor for this market and role). Candidate has EXACT Tech Stack (e.g., Job wants Java/Spring, Candidate has Java/Spring). Candidate has EXACT Years of Experience (or more). Candidate has RELEVANT Domain Knowledge (e.g., Defense, Finance, Healthcare). 8â€“9 (Strong Fit): Salary matches or is unknown but plausible. Candidate has all Core Technical Skills. Missing only minor "Nice-to-have" tools. Domain match is good but not perfect. 6â€“7 (Capable but Gaps): Salary matches or is unknown. Candidate fits the general role (e.g., Software Engineer) but uses a different stack (e.g., Job wants React, Candidate knows Angular). OR Candidate is slightly junior for the role. 1â€“5 (Weak Match): Salary matches or is unknown. Candidate lacks core technical requirements (e.g., Python dev applying for Embedded C++ role). OR Candidate is significantly over/under qualified. 0 (Automatic Fail): Salary logic failed because salary is known AND below floor (Case A FAIL). You are not allowed to output match_score = 0 when JOB_CEILING == 0. For unknown salary you must choose a score from 1â€“9 based on skills. ðŸ“ EXTRACTION RULES job_description: Summarize in <100 words. responsibilities / qualifications: Format exactly: "Point 1;\\nPoint 2;\\nPoint 3". apply_link: Extract from apply_options. Format HTML {publisher}. Join multiple with ;\\n. Max 4 links. remote: "Yes" or "No". salary: Extract original salary text string. If empty, print the job_min_salary - job_max_salary range if those numbers exist; otherwise leave as empty string. match_reason: If match_score == 0 and JOB_CEILING > 0: "Job max salary ($[JOB_CEILING]) is below candidate floor ($[MIN_FLOOR])." If JOB_CEILING == 0: You MUST NOT write "Job max salary ($0) is below candidate floor ($[MIN_FLOOR])." Salary is unknown, not below floor. If match_score > 0: "Salary is not specified, but skills are a [weak/moderate/strong] fit. [Strict assessment of skill gaps or fit]." If JOB_CEILING > 0 and match_score > 0: "Salary fits ($[JOB_CEILING]). [Strict assessment of skill gaps or fit]." If match_score is below 6 or 7 because of missing skills or other qualifications, explicitly list each missing or weak skill in match_reason. FINAL OUTPUT JSON Return ONLY this single JSON object. No backticks, no extra text, no explanations. { "job_title": "", "job_description": "", "company": "", "employment_type": "", "remote": "", "salary": "", "benefits": "", "responsibilities": "", "qualifications": "", "apply_link": "", "match_score": 0, "match_reason": "" }

data.job_description:
DESCRIPTION

Operations is at the heart of Amazonâ€™s business. We are known for our speed, accuracy, and exceptional service. Our buildings deliver tens of thousands of products to hundreds of countries worldwide, every day. The Reliability & Maintenance Engineering (RME) team are the business partners that work tirelessly behind the scenes to make it happen. We drive continuous improvement, and maintain all of the robotics and material handling equipment (MHE) to ensure our customers are met with the Amazon smile. Come join us on our journey!

About the Role:
As the Senior Regional Automation Engineer, you will engage on all aspects of high-level support for the control systems within a region of Amazon sites. This work takes the form of direct field engagement for launch and existing facilities, commissioning, on-call, continuous improvement, change management, project management, training, security, infrastructure and systems administration. You will deliver this through the use of statistics and data analytics, structured problem solving, implementation of global support mechanisms, system performance monitoring tools, identification and dissemination of best practices. In this role, you will also develop and implement standard operating procedures, optimal code/parameter sets, performance metrics, and feedback mechanisms to ensure reliability and operational efficiency of our equipment.

What Do We Offer?
Amazon offers competitive compensation packages including comprehensive healthcare benefits starting on Day 1, matching 401(k) program, and up to 20 weeks of paid parental leave. But wait, thereâ€™s more: We provide lightweight fire-resistant daily wear and composite toe safety shoes for your safety!

Key job responsibilities
Key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
â€¢ Understand and troubleshoot material handling control systems, including PLC/PC controllers, industrial networks (Ethernet, ControlNet, DeviceNet, Profibus, Profinet, ASi), motor control systems, servo drives, frequency drives, and electrical distribution systems
â€¢ Apply Subject Matter Expertise (SME) on troubleshooting and dive deeps for engineering issues, supporting a region of onsite automation engineers to investigate the root cause and planning actions to eliminate/mitigate the downtime of critical assets
â€¢ Programming and source coding for in-house built solutions based in PLC or PC controllers and SCADA/OEE platforms
â€¢ Develop solutions related to Automation Systems
â€¢ Project Management (PM) of large-scale initiatives that will require work activities coordination of site-based Automation Engineers (AE) to accomplish goals of the business
â€¢ Create, optimize and monitor Key Performance Indicators (KPI) for control the efficiency, availability and quality of the machines, generating reports for improvement purposes.
â€¢ Communicate with Vendors and senior leadership to plan and coordinate technical resolutions for local teams or network wide issues
â€¢ Provide technical guidance and decision making for collaboration projects or initiatives with other Amazon teams, being a key stakeholder in supporting technical and major network support requests
â€¢ Provide 24/7 on-call rotational support for hardware and software systems across multiple sites
â€¢ Travel up to 80%

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
â€¢ Bachelor's degree in computer science, electrical engineering, automation engineering, or equivalent, or 7+ years of PLC programming or automation engineering experience
â€¢ Work a flexible schedule/shift/work area, including weekends, nights, and/or holidays
â€¢ 7+ years of of experience working in industrial controls and automation
â€¢ 7+ years of process or production environment related PLC-controlled automation and issue diagnosis experience
â€¢ 7+ years of robotics work cells and control systems experience
â€¢ 7+ years of Siemens, Allen-Bradley or Codesys Ladder Logic and structure programming experience
â€¢ 7+ years of electrical theory, robotics, controls components, and automated equipment experience

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
â€¢ Advanced degree in computer science, electrical engineering, automation engineering
â€¢ Experience with HMI and control network components, including maintenance, troubleshooting, programming and design
â€¢ Experience with programming software such as RSLogix5000, Studio 5000, FT View, and other controls software platforms
â€¢ MBA or other Masterâ€™s degree and/or Six Sigma Black Belt Certification a plus
â€¢ Manufacturing or complex industry experience leading Controls

Senior Automation Engineer

Location: Hybrid (Hopedale, Massachusetts)

Employment Type: Full-Time

Position Overview

We are seeking an experienced Senior Automation Engineer with deep expertise in Rockwell Automation platforms. This role focuses on the design, development, and support of industrial automation systems, with a strong emphasis on Allenâ€‘Bradley PLCs and FactoryTalk View SE/ME. The position is hybrid, combining on-site work at the Hopedale, MA facility with remote flexibility, and supports automation initiatives across manufacturing operations.

Key Responsibilities
â€¢ Design, develop, and implement industrial automation solutions using Rockwell Automation technologies
â€¢ Program, configure, and troubleshoot Allenâ€‘Bradley PLCs (ControlLogix, CompactLogix, and related platforms)
â€¢ Develop, maintain, and support HMI/SCADA applications using FactoryTalk View SE and ME
â€¢ Collaborate closely with engineering, production, and maintenance teams to deliver automation projects
â€¢ Perform system testing, validation, commissioning, and start-up support
â€¢ Provide technical troubleshooting and ongoing support for automation systems

We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Project Lead / Automation Engineer with deep expertise in Scrum, Project Management, and Tricentis Tosca to lead enterprise test automation initiatives across complex business and technology landscapes. This role blends hands-on automation architecture with technical project leadership, ensuring delivery excellence, platform stability, and measurable business outcomes. The ideal candidate is equally comfortable designing robust automation frameworks, guiding delivery teams, engaging stakeholders using excellent communication, and owning execution across the full automation lifecycle

Duties/Responsibilities:

- Automation Architecture & Engineering:
â€¢ Serve as the Tosca Architect, responsible for solution design, best practices, and scalable automation frameworks
â€¢ Design, build, and maintain end-to-end automated test suites using Tosca for functional, regression, and integration testing
â€¢ Establish and enforce automation standards, naming conventions, reuse strategies, and modular design
â€¢ Lead CI/CD integration of Tosca with enterprise toolchains (e.g., Jenkins, Azure DevOps, Git, ALM/qTest)
â€¢ Drive automation for SAP and non-SAP applications, including web, APIs, and backend systems
â€¢ Troubleshoot complex automation issues and optimize execution stability and performance

- Technical Project Leadership:

â€¢ Translate business and quality objectives into executable automation roadmaps
â€¢ Provide hands-on guidance, mentoring, and technical leadership to automation engineers
â€¢ Lead sprint-level planning, backlog grooming, and execution tracking for automation workstreams
â€¢ Identify delivery risks early and proactively implement mitigation strategies.

- Platform Ownership & Governance:
â€¢ Own day-to-day automation platform health, including Tosca Server, execution agents, and supporting infrastructure
â€¢ Partner with infrastructure and DevOps teams on environment readiness and scalability
â€¢ Establish governance around test data, environment usage, and execution scheduling
â€¢ Define and track automation KPIs (coverage, execution time, defect leakage, stability)
â€¢ Ensure automation practices align with enterprise compliance, audit, and quality standards.

- Stakeholder Engagement:
â€¢ Serve as the primary technical point of contact for automation with QA leadership, application teams, and program stakeholders
â€¢ Provide clear status reporting, risk updates, and value metrics to leadership
â€¢ Support solutioning discussions, estimates, and roadmap planning for new automation initiatives
â€¢ Advocate for automation-first and shift-left quality practices across delivery teams

Required Skills/Abilities:
â€¢ 8+ years in software testing and quality engineering
â€¢ 5+ years of hands-on experience with Tricentis Tosca (automation design, execution, and optimization)

â€¢ Strong understanding of test automation frameworks, test design, and QA best practices
â€¢ Experience automating complex enterprise systems (ERP, CRM, custom platforms)
â€¢ Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills
â€¢ Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders
â€¢ Up to 6 weeks a year of travel.

Preferred Qualifications:
â€¢ Experience with SAP (ECC, S/4HANA, or SAP Cloud solutions)
â€¢ Experience with Tosca Server, Distributed Execution (DEX), or similar execution models
â€¢ Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
â€¢ Experience integrating automation with test management tools (qTest, ALM, Jira, Azure DevOps)
â€¢ Prior experience supporting regulated or highly governed environments
â€¢ Energy Industry Experience

What Success Looks Like:
â€¢ Automation is stable, scalable, and trusted by delivery teams

â€¢ Predictable, high-quality releases enabled by automation

â€¢ U.S. Citizenship Required.
â€¢ Must have the ability to obtain / maintain a Public Trust clearance.
â€¢ 16 years of experience managing large, distributed IT teams (100+ personnel).
â€¢ Demonstrated success delivering IT services or systems in federal or highly regulated environments.
â€¢ Strong understanding of IT service delivery models, operational governance, and performance management.
â€¢ Ability to manage competing priorities across technical, operational, and personnel domains.
â€¢ Experience supporting contract execution, staffing plans, and compliance reporting.
â€¢ Excellent communication skills, including experience briefing executive leadership and government customers.
â€¢ Strong risk management and decision-making capabilities in high-visibility environments.

Preferred Qualifications

â€¢ Certifications such as PMP, ITIL Managing Professional, or SAFe Agilist.
â€¢ Experience supporting FAA, DOT, or other aviation or transportation programs.
â€¢ Familiarity with NextGen, large-scale modernization, or safety-critical systems.
â€¢ Background in change management, organizational transformation, or program turnarounds.
â€¢ Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate, mentor, and retain high-performing teams.

#BNATC

Join Peraton in advancing the safety, efficiency, and modernization of the National Airspace System (NAS) through the FAAâ€™s Brand New Air Traffic Control System (BNATCS) contract. As a trusted partner to the Federal Aviation Administration, Peraton helps deliver the systems and services that keep our nationâ€™s skies safe and connected. Weâ€™re looking for innovative professionals who thrive in mission-critical environments and are passionate about shaping the future of air traffic management. This is your chance to make an impact on one of the worldâ€™s most vital transportation infrastructures, working alongside leaders in aviation, engineering, data science, and systems integration.

At Peraton, you wonâ€™t just support the mission â€” youâ€™ll define it.

Help shape the future of U.S. airspace safety and efficiency. Peraton is seeking an experienced Automation Workflow Manager to support the execution, oversight, and growth of large-scale IT programs aligned to the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). This role partners closely with the Program Director to manage daily operations, technical delivery, workforce performance, and stakeholder engagement for a diverse organization of 100â€“150 IT professionals spanning engineering, operations, cybersecurity, and service delivery functions. The ideal candidate is a proven leader with strong operational discipline, financial acumen, and experience delivering complex IT services in a regulated federal environment. This position requires the ability to balance strategic objectives with hands-on execution while maintaining alignment with FAA mission priorities.
â€¢ Must be available to support weekend and after-hours work as required.*

Work Location:
â€¢ This position will work on site in the DC Metro area. Once operations are fully established, we will consider telework options however, this is not guaranteed.

Duties to include, but not be limited to:
â€¢ Lead integrated BNATCS execution across multiple Automation domains.
â€¢ Managing scope, cost, schedule, and risk. Coordinates FAA governance, integrator, and OEM stakeholders, drives milestone reviews and decision forums, and ensures readiness for commissioning and operational turnover.
â€¢ Oversee day-to-day program operations.
â€¢ Lead and manage a workforce of 100â€“150 IT professionals, including managers, engineers, analysts, and operational staff.
â€¢ Ensure delivery of IT services and solutions meets contractual SLAs, KPIs, and FAA performance expectations.
â€¢ Oversee program execution, including schedule, staffing, risk, and issue management.
â€¢ Partner with technical leads to ensure alignment across infrastructure, applications, cybersecurity, service desk, cloud, and platform teams.
â€¢ Support budget planning, cost control, labor forecasting, and financial reporting in coordination with finance and contracts teams.
â€¢ Drive workforce performance through resource planning, succession planning, training, and performance management.
â€¢ Manage cross-functional dependencies and resolve escalated operational, technical, and personnel issues.
â€¢ Ensure compliance with FAA AMS, RMF, NIST, and contractual governance requirements.
â€¢ Support customer engagement, executive briefings, and program reviews with FAA stakeholders.
â€¢ Lead continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service quality, efficiency, and team effectiveness.

Why This Role Matters

FAA programs underpin the safety, reliability, and modernization of the National Airspace System (NAS). As the Workflow Manager, you ensure that large, multi-disciplinary IT teams deliver consistent, high-quality services while meeting cost, schedule, performance, and compliance requirements. Your leadership directly impacts workforce stability, operational readiness, and the FAAâ€™s ability to modernize critical systems without disruption.

Overview

About Pinterest
Millions of people around the world come to our platform to find creative ideas, dream about new possibilities and plan for memories that will last a lifetime. At Pinterest, weâ€™re on a mission to bring everyone the inspiration to create a life they love, and that starts with the people behind the product.

Discover a career where you ignite innovation for millions, transform passion into growth opportunities, celebrate each otherâ€™s unique experiences and embrace the flexibility to do your best work. Creating a career you love? Itâ€™s Possible.

Pinterest Support Operations (PSO) is the primary customer support function at Pinterest and a key part of the customer experience with our consumer and ad products.

Role

We are seeking a passionate, strategic, and experienced Director of TPM (Technical Program Management) Support Operations to lead our rapidly evolving TPM Support organization. In this role, you will:
â€¢ Understand the end to end customer journeys that exist at Pinterest and develop a unified, future-ready toolset for support operations, prioritizing top issue types, worst experiences and revenue impacts
â€¢ Create and execute against a detailed 2026/2027 roadmap that reduces internal tooling, entry point and other complexities while improving customer/seller experience and operational efficiency. This work will be conducted in close collaboration with the CIO organization and other key stakeholders across the company, including those from Trust and Safety, Sales, Pinterest Support Operations, etc
â€¢ Improve self service adoption and effectiveness, as measured by percent of issues effectively resolved through automation, cost to serve and other KPIs
â€¢ Ensure the continuous health and reliability of all support entry points, routing systems, and our overall support tech stack (and enact contingency plans in the event of disruptions)
â€¢ Lead well, directing the work of a team of TPMs, and outsourced Engineering resources, ensuring goal alignment while demonstrating Pinterest values

Together, youâ€™ll help us build the future of support at Pinterest â€”driving changes that will impact Pinners, Advertisers, Merchants, Creators, and Business Partners at scale.

What Youâ€™ll Do
â€¢ Develop and execute the vision, strategy, and roadmap for TPM Support Operations aligned with Pinterestâ€™s business objectives.
â€¢ Identify what best in class automation rates and support experiences are, and create a plan for Pinterest to achieve parity.
â€¢ Lead, mentor, and grow a team of talented program managers, enabling them to deliver impact and drive their professional development.
â€¢ Partner with cross-functional leaders (Engineering, Product, Operations, HR, and others) to identify and address gaps in support tooling, process, governance, and reporting.
â€¢ Design and implement scalable processes, frameworks, and tools to support TPMs in their project delivery, GTM (Go To Market), and stakeholder engagement.
â€¢ Drive automation, and operational efficiency, focused on improving customer experience, and resolution velocity.
â€¢ Establish and track critical metrics for TPM operations, delivering insights, action items and outcomes to leadership.
â€¢ Act as a change agent, helping teams navigate transformation and championing a culture of operational excellence and continuous learning.

Who We're Looking For
â€¢ 10+ years of experience in technical program management, support operations, or a related field, with at least 5 years of people management experience.
â€¢ Demonstrated ability to build, lead, and inspire large, distributed teams in a dynamic environment.
â€¢ Strong track record of designing and implementing operational support strategies and change management initiatives.
â€¢ Deep expertise in the ever evolving landscape of available external Gen AI tools and applicability in this environment.
â€¢ Exceptional communication, collaboration, empathy and stakeholder management skills.
â€¢ Proven ability to influence, build shared goals, align conflicts of interests and partner with leaders at all levels, including executive stakeholders.
â€¢ Experience working in a high-growth technology company or fast-paced environment.
â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s degree in a relevant, technology-related field such as Computer Science, Engineering, or IT, or equivalent experience.

In-Office Requirement Statement
â€¢ We recognize that the ideal environment for work is situational and may differ across departments. What this looks like day-to-day can vary based on the needs of each organization or role.
â€¢ This role will need to be in the office for in-person collaboration 1-2 times every 6-months and therefore can be situated anywhere in the country.

Relocation Statement
â€¢ This position is not eligible for relocation assistance. Visit our PinFlex page to learn more about our working model.

At Pinterest we believe the workplace should be equitable, inclusive, and inspiring for every employee. In an effort to provide greater transparency, we are sharing the base salary range for this position. The position is also eligible for equity. Final salary is based on a number of factors including location, travel, relevant prior experience, or particular skills and expertise.

Information regarding the culture at Pinterest and benefits available for this position can be found here.

US based applicants only

$192,929â€”$397,206 USD

Our Commitment To Inclusion

Pinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, status as a protected veteran, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information or characteristics (or those of a family member) or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require a medical or religious accommodation during the job application process, please complete this form for support.

data.job_description:
Job Description

Operates and maintains direct digital control (DDC) and building automation systems (BAS) to provide a safe, comfortable learning environment and use resources efficiently.

Responsibilities

EXAMPLES OF DUTIES:
â€¢ Troubleshoots and repairs, on site and remotely, DDC and BAS systems including hardware and software.
â€¢ Responds to service calls from leadership and those generated by BAS and DDC systems. Restores the operation of heating ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) systems.
â€¢ Performs programming using various software packages to maintain and improve system operation.
â€¢ Identifies energy savings opportunities that can be achieved through repairs or changes of sequence in HVAC systems.
â€¢ Assists in the commission of new systems and coordinates checkout and warranty calls by installation contractors. Identifies system deficiencies in new BAS and DDC installations.
â€¢ Coordinates with other trades including mechanical and electrical to resolve repair issues. Coordinates with the environmental group to make HVAC-related repairs that may contribute to indoor air quality problems.
â€¢ Initiates service calls. Escalates service calls as required when the operation of HVAC systems cannot be restored in a timely manner. Supports the efforts of other HVAC and Building Automation Technicians.
â€¢ Coordinates the scheduling of HVAC equipment controlled by BAS systems through the Energy Management Supervisor both at schools and remotely through operator workstations.
â€¢ Records and maintains accurate records of work performed, time and materials used. Maintains supplies, materials, and equipment inventory for maintenance of BAS and DDC systems.
â€¢ Communicates appropriately and frequently with faculty, school administrators, supervisor/manager(s) and other employees.
â€¢ Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Education, Training, and Experience:
â€¢ Possession of a high school diploma or an appropriate equivalent.
â€¢ One year of experience in the operation and maintenance of HVAC equipment with building automation and/or direct digital control systems.

Licenses and Certifications
â€¢ Possession of a valid class C Maryland driver's license or an equivalent.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
â€¢ Knowledge of heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems. Knowledge of direct digital control (DDC) and building automation systems (BAS). Knowledge of personal computers and software.
â€¢ Skill in the operation, repair, programming, and maintenance of HVAC, BAS, and/or DDC systems. Skill in the operation of personal computers and software:must be proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel to be able to complete work order, provide reports on work completed and create spreadsheets to record data and information. Skill in communicating effectively.
â€¢ Ability to learn Baltimore County Public School system safety, procedural and policy guidelines, and applicable government regulations. Ability to train others to operate, program, and repair building automation systems and direct digital control systems.

PHYSICAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS:
â€¢ The work of this class entails heavy physical labor including frequent walking, standing, kneeling, reaching, bending, digging, lifting, and carrying objects of moderate to heavy weight, ascending/descending ladders, scaffolds, stairs and the use of tools and equipment.
â€¢ Works in confined spaces in proximity to loud machinery, frequently requires accessing and positioning oneself to reach limited access spaces including but not limited to crawl spaces, roofs, trenches, pits, manholes, attics, and tunnels.
â€¢ Recognizes exposure to live circuits and/or operating machinery in adverse weather conditions and travel to sites throughout Baltimore County.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:
â€¢ Persons appointed to this classification are designated as Essential Personnel and are required to work when schools and/or offices are closed during adverse weather conditions or any other emergency.
â€¢ In addition to working the assigned work schedule, persons appointed to this class work scheduled overtime and must be available for emergency overtime when the need arises by responding to overtime calls before and after standard scheduled hours of work.
â€¢ Persons appointed to this class may be requested to work an alternative schedule or shift temporarily as designated by supervisor.
â€¢ Persons appointed to this class are designated as essential personnel and as such may be required to work during emergency events.
â€¢ A license to drive in the State of Maryland and the ability to drive a pickup truck or van is required.
â€¢ License(s) if/when required for this position are subject to verification and must be maintained in good and active standing during the duration of employment without lapse. Lapse or void in valid/active licensure may result in disciplinary action up to and including termination.
â€¢ Some positions in this class must be physically qualified to drive a commercial motor vehicle in accordance with Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration regulations and must remain physically qualified to operate such vehicles throughout their employment. Persons holding a commercial driver's license (CDL) are subject to alcohol and drug testing in accordance with applicable state and federal regulations and Board of Education policy.

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

Retirement: Eligible for the Baltimore County Employees' Retirement System.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT: Persons appointed to this classification are designated as Essential-As-Needed Personnel and are required to work when schools and/or offices are closed during adverse weather conditions or any other emergency when contracted and directed to do so. Employees in this class may be assigned to work nights, evenings, weekends, and/or holidays. Employees are subject to call to duty in emergencies and may be required to work beyond their regularly scheduled hours with little advanced notice. FLSA Status: Exempt

Application Instructions

Please read and carefully follow the instructions provided below.
â€¢ Applicants are required to have a completed application on file for employment with Baltimore County Public Schools (BCPS). Information on your resume and application must match. This information is necessary for salary determination should you receive an offer of employment.
â€¢ Professional references must be submitted to complete your application. Examples of professional references include current and former principals, supervisors, managers, mentor teachers and university/college supervisors. Personal references from colleagues, friends, community members, etc. will not be accepted.
â€¢ Be sure to account for all periods of employment and unemployment. Failure to complete all fields of the "Work Experience" section of the application may result in your application not being considered. A resume will not be the only document considered in determining your qualifications for a position.
â€¢ You MUST attach your unofficial transcript(s) or license(s) to your application if you are applying for a position as a teacher or position which requires Licensure/Certification.

Pre-Employment Requirements:
â€¢ All people employed by the Baltimore County Public Schools, regular and temporary, are required to be fingerprinted and have a criminal background investigation (per COMAR) completed. The fee charged for fingerprinting is $109.
â€¢ Anyone offered employment is required to provide proper identification and documentation of eligibility for employment in the US.
â€¢ If you have military experience, you will be asked to provide a copy of DD214.
â€¢ Official transcripts will be required upon hire and must be sent via escript/clearinghouse from your university.
â€¢ Some positions will require employees to undergo a physical examination and/or drug testing.
â€¢ All newly hired personnel must attend a Benefits and Retirement Orientation meeting.
â€¢ Additional job verification will be required for salary credit.

Contact Information

Office of Staffing & Licensure

Phone: 443-809-7872

Email: lphillips@bcps.org

About Us

Baltimore County Public Schools (BCPS) is the 22nd largest school district in the nation and the 3rd largest in Maryland with over 21,000 employees supporting over 111,000 students. BCPS has 26 Maryland Blue Ribbon Schools of Excellence and 23 National Blue Ribbon schools, 32 magnet schools and 116 magnet programs.

Baltimore County Public Schools is seeking highly effective employees that will inspire, support, and prepare our students for a successful future. BCPS works to embrace all stakeholders, engage them in authentic collaboration and empower them to be a part of positive change, so our students, staff, and system will excel. We hope you will join our dynamic community! Apply to work at BCPS!

One year of experience in the operation and maintenance of HVAC equipment with building automation and/or direct digital control systems

Skill in communicating effectively

Ability to train others to operate, program, and repair building automation systems and direct digital control systems

License(s) if/when required for this position are subject to verification and must be maintained in good and active standing during the duration of employment without lapse

Other benefits include paid vacation, paid holiday's, sick, personal business, and bereavement days, and flexible leave options such as FMLA, sick bank, and board approved leaves

Responsibilities: Operates and maintains direct digital control (DDC) and building automation systems (BAS) to provide a safe, comfortable learning environment and use resources efficiently
Troubleshoots and repairs, on site and remotely, DDC and BAS systems including hardware and software
Responds to service calls from leadership and those generated by BAS and DDC systems
Restores the operation of heating ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) systems
Performs programming using various software packages to maintain and improve system operation
Identifies energy savings opportunities that can be achieved through repairs or changes of sequence in HVAC systems
Assists in the commission of new systems and coordinates checkout and warranty calls by installation contractors
Identifies system deficiencies in new BAS and DDC installations
Coordinates with other trades including mechanical and electrical to resolve repair issues
Coordinates with the environmental group to make HVAC-related repairs that may contribute to indoor air quality problems
Initiates service calls
Escalates service calls as required when the operation of HVAC systems cannot be restored in a timely manner
Supports the efforts of other HVAC and Building Automation Technicians
Coordinates the scheduling of HVAC equipment controlled by BAS systems through the Energy Management Supervisor both at schools and remotely through operator workstations
Records and maintains accurate records of work performed, time and materials used
Maintains supplies, materials, and equipment inventory for maintenance of BAS and DDC systems
Communicates appropriately and frequently with faculty, school administrators, supervisor/manager(s) and other employees
Performs other duties as assigned

The work of this class entails heavy physical labor including frequent walking, standing, kneeling, reaching, bending, digging, lifting, and carrying objects of moderate to heavy weight, ascending/descending ladders, scaffolds, stairs and the use of tools and equipment

Works in confined spaces in proximity to loud machinery, frequently requires accessing and positioning oneself to reach limited access spaces including but not limited to crawl spaces, roofs, trenches, pits, manholes, attics, and tunnels
Recognizes exposure to live circuits and/or operating machinery in adverse weather conditions and travel to sites throughout Baltimore County

In addition to working the assigned work schedule, persons appointed to this class work scheduled overtime and must be available for emergency overtime when the need arises by responding to overtime calls before and after standard scheduled hours of work

Company Description

Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.

By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.

From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.

Job Description

Job Summary:

The Mac Desktop Engineer (Software & Hardware) â€“ JAMF is responsible for engineering, supporting, and continuously improving the enterprise macOS endpoint experience. This role blends macOS device management and automation with hands-on hardware diagnostics and repair for Mac computers and related peripherals. The Mac Desktop Engineer is expected to deliver macOS engineering projects with a focus on stability, security, scalability, and endâ€‘user experience, while adhering to enterprise standards and operational best practices. The engineer will use JAMF Pro (and related tooling) to deliver secure, scalable management, improve Self Service workflows, and ensure Macs meet enterprise security and compliance expectationsâ€”while providing expert break/fix hardware support when needed.

Key Responsibilities
â€¢ macOS Engineering & Endpoint Management (JAMF)
â€¢ Engineer, implement, and maintain macOS management capabilities using JAMF Pro, including enrollment workflows, configuration profiles, policies, and software delivery.
â€¢ Standardize and document configurations and policies to improve operational consistency and reduce manual intervention.
â€¢ Improve end-user experience through Self Service optimization and automation-driven workflows.
â€¢ Partner with Security/Identity teams to support modern onboarding and access workflows (e.g., identity-aligned enrollment and posture-based access patterns).

Software Delivery, Packaging & Automation
â€¢ Package, test, and deploy macOS applications and updates; manage patching and software lifecycle to maintain security posture and stability.
â€¢ Delivers macOS engineering projects endâ€‘toâ€‘end, including design, implementation, validation, documentation, and operational handoff. Ensures JAMFâ€‘managed Mac solutions are secure, scalable, supportable, and aligned to enterprise EUC standards while improving user experience and operational efficiency.
â€¢ Support modern change practices through automation (including CI/CD-aligned approaches where applicable) and improve visibility through reporting and telemetry.
â€¢ Develop and maintain scripts and automations (e.g., Bash, Python, PowerShell where relevant to cross-platform operations) to reduce toil and improve reliability.

Mac Hardware Diagnostics & Repair (Break/Fix + Lifecycle)
â€¢ Diagnose hardware failures on Mac devices (MacBook, iMac, Mac mini) using appropriate diagnostics and troubleshooting techniques.
â€¢ Perform component replacements and repairs (e.g., screens, batteries, keyboards, and other FRU/component-level work), validate device health post-repair, and coordinate parts/inventory activities.
â€¢ Execute device lifecycle tasks: new device setup, reimaging/rebuilding, system upgrades, peripheral setup, and migration support.

Security, Compliance & Risk Alignment
â€¢ Implement and maintain endpoint security measures and ensure macOS devices align to enterprise security policies and compliance expectations.
â€¢ Support endpoint security tooling and posture visibilityâ€”contributing to dashboards and recurring reporting for continuous improvement.

Customer Support, Field/Onsite Support & Collaboration
â€¢ Provide advanced tier support for macOS incidents and requests; communicate clearly with end users and stakeholders, providing status updates and resolution guidance.
â€¢ Collaborate with other IT teams (endpoint, security, network, service management) to resolve complex issues and deliver cross-functional improvements.
â€¢ Contribute to onboarding, migrations, upgrades, and EUC initiatives impacting the Mac user base.

Documentation & Knowledge Management
â€¢ Create and maintain technical documentation, runbooks, and knowledge articles; maintain accurate ticket notes and service records in the organizationâ€™s ticketing system.

Qualifications

Required
â€¢ 3â€“5 yearsâ€™ experience in desktop engineering, endpoint operations, or macOS-focused EUC roles.
â€¢ Demonstrated experience with JAMF Pro administration (policies, configuration profiles, software deployment, and troubleshooting).
â€¢ Strong macOS troubleshooting skills across OS, applications, and endpoint configuration.
â€¢ Hands-on experience diagnosing and repairing Mac hardware, including common break/fix scenarios.
â€¢ Scripting/automation capability (Bash/Python preferred; PowerShell helpful for mixed environments).
â€¢ Strong communication and customer service skills; able to translate technical issues for non-technical users.

Preferred
â€¢ Experience modernizing macOS management practices (documentation, standardization, reporting/analytics, automation-driven change).
â€¢ Familiarity with security tooling and posture reporting concepts for macOS endpoints (dashboards, telemetry, continuous improvement loops).
â€¢ Apple certification such as ACMT (or willingness to obtain).
â€¢ Experience supporting service management integration and workflow automation.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Additional Employee Requirements
â€¢ Participation in both internal meetings and external meetings via video calls, as necessary.
â€¢ Ability to go into corporate or client offices to work onsite, as necessary.
â€¢ Prolonged periods of remaining stationary at a desk and working on a computer, as necessary.
â€¢ Ability to bend, kneel, crouch, and reach overhead, as necessary.
â€¢ Hand-eye coordination necessary to operate computers and various pieces of office equipment, as necessary.
â€¢ Vision abilities including close vision, toleration of fluorescent lighting, and adjusting focus, as necessary.
â€¢ For positions that require business travel and/or event attendance, ability to lift 25 lbs, as necessary.
â€¢ For positions that require business travel and/or event attendance, a valid driverâ€™s license and acceptable driving record are required, as driving is an essential job function.
â€¢ If requested, reasonable accommodations will be made to enable employees requiring accommodations to perform the essential functions of their jobs, absent undue hardship.

USA Benefits (Full time roles only, does not apply to contractor positions)
â€¢ Robust healthcare and benefits including Medical, Dental, vision, Disability coverage, and various other benefit options
â€¢ Flexible Spending Accounts (Medical, Transit, and Dependent Care)
â€¢ Employer Paid Life Insurance and AD&D Coverages
â€¢ Health Savings account paired with our low-cost High Deductible Medical Plan
â€¢ 401(k) Safe Harbor Retirement plan with employer match with immediately vest

At Endava, weâ€™re committed to creating an open, inclusive, and respectful environment where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to be their best. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectivesâ€”because we know that inclusive teams help us deliver smarter, more innovative solutions for our customers. Hiring decisions are based on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential. If you need adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please let us know.

6+ Months, possible conversion to FTE This position is remote, but requires quarterly travel to Gaithersburg, MD. â€¢Must have an active Public Trust clearance to be considered for this role.â€¢ Job Description:
Our client is seeking a GenAI Data Automation Engineer to design and implement innovative, AI-driven automation solutions across AWS and Azure hybrid environments. You will be responsible for building intelligent, scalable data pipelines and automations that integrate cloud services, enterprise tools, and Generative AI to support mission-critical analytics, reporting, and customer engagement platforms. encryption, VPC isolation, RBAC, and firewalls. Support Agile DevOps processes with sprint-based delivery of pipeline and AI-enabled features. Required Qualifications:

Good communication and presentation skills. Duties
â€¢ Prepares a wide variety of recurring and nonrecurring personal and executive correspondence, reports, and other documents from information obtained from the staff, files, and other sources. Routinely composes non-technical correspondence, such as office procedures, requests for information concerning the organization's programs, letters of acknowledgment, commendation, or notification.
â€¢ Reviews and processes incoming and outgoing correspondence, reports, and other materials submitted for the Commander's signature. Receives and screens all publications, regulations, and directives directed to the Commander and brings to the Commander's attention those elements affecting the Commander's area of jurisdiction; specifically indicating procedural changes and furnishing all related materials.
â€¢ Receives telephone calls, greets visitors and ascertains the nature of the calls or visits, screening those that can be handled without supervisor's help. Places both local and long-distance calls for Commander or staff personnel. Monitors visitors including general officers, distinguished Air Force and Department of Defense (DoD) visitors, members of Congress and Congressional representatives, foreign dignitaries, high ranking personnel from other government agencies, and to the general public and reports such visits to the Commander.
â€¢ Maintains supervisor's calendar, coordinates meeting arrangements, and schedules meetings and/or conferences including those involving staff from outside the immediate office. Independently notes and follows up on commitments made at meetings and conferences by staff members.
â€¢ Performs other clerical and administrative work in support of the office/organization. Develops, establishes, updates, and maintains office procedures and records/files of various types to ensure effective and efficient operation of the office. Serves as liaison between the supervisor and subordinate units.
â€¢ Uses varied and advanced functions of word processing software to create, format, modify, edit, and print a variety of letters, reports, memos, and other textual documents. Uses advanced functions to generate tables of contents, import graphs or databases, create glossaries, and align multiple columns.
Requirements

Conditions of employment
â€¢ U.S. Citizenship Required
â€¢ Males must be registered for Selective Service, see www.sss.gov
â€¢ If authorized, PCS will be paid IAW JTR and AF Regulations. If receiving an authorized PCS, you may be subject to completing/signing a CONUS agreement. More information on PCS requirements, may be found at: https://afciviliancareers.com/regulatory/
â€¢ This position is subject to provisions of the DoD Priority Placement Program
â€¢ Disclosure of Political Appointments
â€¢ Depending on the type of position (competitive/excepted) you are selected for, you will be required to serve a 1-year probationary period OR 2-year trial period.
â€¢ Upon completion of your probationary/trial period, your employment will be terminated unless you receive certification, in writing, that your continued employment advances the public interest.
â€¢ Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance
â€¢ Applicants must meet the OPM qualification standard and must possess the following skill: Must be able to type 40 words per minute (WPM)

Qualifications

In order to qualify, you must meet the specialized experience requirements described in the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) Qualification Standards for General Schedule Positions, Clerical and Administrative Support Positions.

SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE: Applicants must have at least one (1) year of specialized experience at the next lower grade GS-06 equivalent in other pay systems. Examples of specialized experience includes utilizing word processing software procedures and functions keys to perform a substantial range of functions, such as generating tables of contents, importing graphs or databases, creating glossaries, aligning multiple columns, automatically printing document identification or other notations at the top or bottom of each page, and creating form letters and automatically merging these with mailing lists. Knowledge of standard office equipment, such as electric/electronic typewriters, copiers, fax machines, and office automation systems, to perform a substantial range of office automation support. Knowledge of the substantive programs of the organization as they relate to administrative and clerical support functions.

FEDERAL TIME-IN-GRADE (TIG) REQUIREMENT FOR GENERAL SCHEDULE (GS) POSITIONS: Merit promotion applicants must meet applicable time-in-grade requirements to be considered eligible. One year at the GS-06 level is required to meet the time-in-grade requirements for the GS-07 level. TIG applies if you are in a current GS position or held a GS position within the previous 52 weeks.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (KSAs): Your qualifications will be evaluated on the basis of your level of knowledge, skills, abilities and/or competencies in the following areas:

1. Knowledge of extensive rules, procedures, or operations applied to secretarial and clerical assignments to perform the procedural and administrative work of the office, such as preparing and editing documents, locating and assembling information for various reports, maintaining files/records, and making and preparing travel arrangements.

2. Knowledge of office functions and commitments of supervisor and staff to prepare and review correspondence, to screen telephone calls and visitors, to maintain supervisor's calendar, and to perform other substantive or administrative work of the organization.

3. Knowledge of correct grammar, spelling, punctuation, capitalization, and format to accurately prepare and edit written correspondence and reports.

4. Knowledge of word processing automation software functions to support office operations and produce a variety of textual documents such as letters, reports, memos, and form letters.

5. Skill in typing; a qualified typist is required. Ability to locate, assemble, and compose information for reports, inquiries, and non-technical correspondence.

6. Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing. Ability to plan, organize work, and meet deadlines.

PART-TIME OR UNPAID EXPERIENCE: Credit will be given for appropriate unpaid and or part-time work. You must clearly identify the duties and responsibilities in each position held and the total number of hours per week.

VOLUNTEER WORK EXPERIENCE: Refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service Programs (i.e., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student and social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge and skills that can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.

Education

This job does not have an education qualification requirement.

The Director â€“ Drone Delivery Market Expansion and Site Readiness, Automation Engineering will lead the footprint expansion of drone delivery at Walmart. data.job_description:
Robotics Process Automation (RPA) Project Manager (REMOTE)

Newark, NJ

Job Overview:

Are you interested in improving and shaping the delivery of the IT projects industry? Weâ€™re seeking a Robotics Process Automation (RPA) Project Manager to oversee a project delivering robotics for applications. This person should be motivated by variety, is seeking a challenging environment for professional growth, and is interested in running large information technology projects in various customer businesses areas at an Investor-Owned Utility client headquartered in New Jersey.

This position is responsible for planning, coordinating, monitoring, and implementing complex large-scale projects to meet organizational goals. This person will maintain the efficiency of important aspects of the project management process such as planning, budget, and risk assessment. The ideal candidate is required to have excellent project management skills, with experience in organizing, planning, and executing large-scale projects from vision to implementation involving internal personnel, contractors, and vendors.

If this sounds like the kind of environment where you can thrive, keep reading!

Location: This position is remote

Responsibilities:
â€¢ Lead and manage end-to-end automation projects, including scoping, planning, execution, monitoring, and successful delivery within defined timelines and budgets.
â€¢ Manage technical, cost, and schedule of assigned tasks or functions.
â€¢ Provide strong, proactive, and assertive leadership skills that engage multidiscipline work teams to respond to business needs for assigned projects
â€¢ Lead project team members such as executives, line of business subject matter experts, controllers, and schedulers through the lifecycle of a project
â€¢ Support the Automation program with training, mentoring and instructional guides to support the automation staff with procedures, best practices, and risk reduction practice
â€¢ Provide requirement analysis, application interaction analysis, system integration testing support, automation monitoring and logging support
â€¢ Create project management plans, set expectations, execute governance reviews and ensure the project plans are driven by organizational procedures
â€¢ Coordinates with cross-functional project stakeholders to develop project scope, objectives, goals, and deliverables
â€¢ Ensures that requirements are gathered, documented, reviewed and approved per organizational/PMO standards.
â€¢ Work with assigned scheduler to create a work breakdown structure that defines all activities required for the project deliverables
â€¢ Manage project budget, maintain financial plan, track actuals vs. plan, provide monthly forecasts, report monthly accruals
â€¢ Establish and provide high-quality, informative written and verbal project communications, including weekly status, dashboards, and project updates
â€¢ Actively monitor, track, and manage project tasks, timelines, attainment of established milestones and overall quality of project activities and deliverables

Required Education & Experience:
â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s Degree in Business, Information Technology, Computer Science, MIS, or similar degree. Additional years of experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
â€¢ 6+ years of strong Project Management experience
â€¢ Previous experience with automation projects required
â€¢ In depth Project Management Experience handling Project Financials, Schedules, Scope, Testing with strong communication / Presentation Skills
â€¢ Solid understanding of Project Management and Project Management Office
â€¢ Ability to build and maintain relationships, partnerships, and external networks
â€¢ Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision and work effectively in a collaborative team environment while keeping the team informed
â€¢ Excellent customer facing skills
â€¢ Excellent researching, decision-making and organizational skills are required
â€¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills
â€¢ Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
â€¢ Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including Microsoft Project or similar project management tool
â€¢ Maintain confidentiality and adhere to data protection and other guidelines where appropriate.

Preferred Experience:
â€¢ Utility experience preferred
â€¢ Smartsheet experience is a plus
â€¢ PMP preferred

Job Description:

JOB DESCRIPTION: Coordinates all activities for a major project and is directly responsible for project completion. Responsible for assembling project team, assigning individual responsibilities, identifying appropriate resources needed, and developing schedule to ensure timely completion of project, and quality assurance. Interacts with team to develop project plans and prototypes. Works with commercial off the shelf and solutions involving client/server technology. SCOPE: Responsible for coordinating all activities of a major IT-related project and directly responsible for project completion. PROBLEM COMPLEXITY: Complex choices of action which require considerable logic, knowledge and understanding in order to analyze a problem or situation, identify contributing factors, and select an optimal course of action. IMPACT: Erroneous decisions may result in delays and have financial impact to the organization. LIAISON: Regularly interacts with customer and/or functional per group managers. May interact with senior management. Interactions normally involve matters between functional areas, other company divisions or units, or customers and the company. FREEDOM TO ACT: - LEADERSHIP AND MANAGEMENT: Provides focus to subordinates directed by established policies and procedures. Interprets, implements and administers policies that typically affect individual employees of a sub-unit. Provides administration supervision in addition to technical supervision. Performs full range of managerial duties for employees supervised, including recruitment, salary administration, performance reviews, counseling, and employee development. Responsible for maintaining good customer relations to explain technical trade-off to manages and customers who may not have the technical expertise to perform the analysis themselves. KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS AND ABILITY: Reads, writes, interprets and explains technical and/or complex information and possesses communication skills necessary to effectively motivate, teach and lead co-workers and staff. Knowledge of Statistics. Applications programming in conjunction with software engineering methodology; computerized project management software such as MS-Project and PeopleSoft; strong client/server knowledge; system development; database programming; application development, preferably using World Wide Web technology to build web-based applications that combine databases, SQL and web front-ends. TYPICAL EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: Typically requires a bachelor's degree or equivalent and 8+ years related experience in the computer programming field or other qualifying credentials and experience.

data.job_description:
What Makes a Honda, is Who makes a Honda
Honda has a clear vision for the future, and itâ€™s a joyful one. We are looking for individuals with the skills, courage, persistence, and dreams that will help us reach our future-focused goals. At our core is innovation. Honda is constantly innovating and developing solutions to drive our business with record success. We strive to be a company that serves as a source of â€œpowerâ€ that supports people around the world who are trying to do things based on their own initiative and that helps people expand their own potential. To this end, Honda strives to realize â€œthe joy and freedom of mobilityâ€ by developing new technologies and an innovative approach to achieve a â€œzero environmental footprint.â€

We are looking for qualified individuals with diverse backgrounds, experiences, continuous improvement values, and a strong work ethic to join our team.

If your goals and values align with Hondaâ€™s, we want you to join our team to Bring the Future!
Job Purpose

Controls Engineer responsible for planning and implementation to upgrade existing and install new building controls utilizing self, team, and contractor abilities. Design Mechanical systems, develop schedules, budgets and forecasts, select materials, equipment, project staff and contractors. Estimate costs, resources and time required to complete. Ensures controls architecture consistency between sites and analyzes technology trends. Includes focus on development and sustainability of the mechanical infrastructure (HVAC, Chillers, Air compressors, Utilities). Direct site building control related activities, through team members and contractors, to meet site needs (e.g. controls upgrade and replacements, programming optimization, standardization, and operations enhancements). Focus is to maximize cost efficiency and usability while minimizing risk to production and maintenance downtime. Job requires constant interaction with department's engineering and maintenance teams along with external customers and contractors.

This position will be joining the Facilities department in Honda Development & Manufacturing of America, LLCâ€™s (HDMA). The Facilities department is responsible for the building which includes new construction, remodels, utility management (electric, compressed air, natural gas, water), building maintenance, end-of-life equipment replacements and upgrades. The goal of the department is to create a facility that we are proud of and to serve our customers.

Key Accountabilities
â€¢ Manage BMS/BAS(Building Management System/Building Automation Systems) specification, design, and operation. Develop and implement multiyear strategy to complete BMS migration. Collaborate with HDMA Facilities controls leaders to standardize a unified approach. Manage and oversee programming and work with IT networking team.
â€¢ Support operation of Facilities mechanical and electrical systems including but not limited to centrifugal fans, burners, cooling/heating coils, pumps, centrifugal air compressors, centrifugal chillers, heat exchangers, utilities, metering, communications. Manage and maintain documentation for the site Mechanical Systems. Communicate critical updates to site system operators.
â€¢ Implement new engineering strategies and technologies to replace facilities equipment and systems at their end of life (EOL)
â€¢ Lead meetings and negotiate with customers and contractors of all levels and capabilities. Build mutually beneficial relationships with customers and contractors.

Qualifications, Experience, and Skills

Minimum Educational Qualifications

Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering (in Mechanical, Controls or Electrical) or equivalent related controls experience

Minimum Experience

2+ years of relevant working experience in a Controls/Project Management/Facilities Capacity preferred

2+ years working experience with control systems architecture and programming preferred

Other Job-Specific Skills

Use knowledge and experience to continually improve efficiency and effectiveness of tasks within area of expertise

Actively support / participate in project team activities related to significant business innovation; develop and execute activities/tasks to achieve the objectives of the business team

Demonstrate solid base of technical knowledge in day-to-day operations

Working Conditions

Willingness to travel for department reviews and business planning events at other HDMA facilities

50% Manufacturing/Production Environment including construction site locations, 50% office/desk environment Â§ Potential for assignments supporting other HDMA Facilities, Honda Affiliates, or North American Suppliers

Work all appropriate overtime/weekends/shutdowns to manage projects and cover production needs.

What differentiates Honda and makes us an employer of choice?

Total Rewards:
â€¢ Competitive Base Salary (pay will be based on several variables that include, but not limited to geographic location, work experience, etc.)
â€¢ Regional Bonus (when applicable)
â€¢ Manager Lease Car Program (No Cost - Car, Maintenance, and Insurance included)
â€¢ Industry-leading Benefit Plans (Medical, Dental, Vision, Rx)
â€¢ Paid time off, including vacation, holidays, shutdown
â€¢ Company Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
â€¢ 401K Plan with company match + additional contribution
â€¢ Relocation assistance (if eligible)

Career Growth:
â€¢ Advancement Opportunities
â€¢ Career Mobility
â€¢ Education Reimbursement for Continued learning
â€¢ Training and Development Programs

Additional Offerings:
â€¢ Lifestyle Account
â€¢ Childcare Reimbursement Account
â€¢ Elder Care Support
â€¢ Tuition Assistance & Student Loan Repayment
â€¢ Wellbeing Program
â€¢ Community Service and Engagement Programs
â€¢ Product Programs

Honda is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

Job Title: Automation Engineer Sr

Location: Columbus OH (4 days Onsite, 1 day Remote)

Type: 3 Months Contract to Hire

Contract only W2

The Automation Engineer Sr acts as a resource to decision, design, and lead on medium to large automation solutions within the infrastructure/operations tech spaces. The Automation Engineer Srâ€™s primary duty involves design work, specifically designing tailored solutions to meet specific client requests using automation technologies. This role is responsible for designing, developing, and implementing automation solutions for our Infrastructure Engineering teams. This role is also responsible for maintaining and supporting questions and processes related to Orchestration for Infrastructure Engineering teams as well as providing guidance and helping to establish Automation standards intended to streamline the ability for other teams to pursue building automation.
A good candidate should be comfortable guiding efforts from initial idea through design, vetting, pitching, building, completion, and metric reporting. This role has an expectation of both direct automation development skills and the soft skills to effectively communicate and mentor other infrastructure engineers in building out their own development knowledge. The ability to distinguish between automation needs and process needs and solution on both is integral for success in this position.

Detailed Description
â€¢ Scale of work focus: Medium to large projects that frequently span multiple teams.
â€¢ Presentation skills expected: director level and medium groups that may involve a range of teams.
â€¢ Ability to identify value opportunities and assist in quantifying value in new initiatives brought forward.
â€¢ Communicates complex technical problems and solutions in articulate and easily understood way.
â€¢ Recognizes new value-drivers in existing efforts and how those value-drivers may be aligned tactically with other work initiatives.
â€¢ Clearly grasps gaps, risks and concerns related to current efforts and proactively adjusts plans as needed to avoid impact to expected effort delivery.
â€¢ Builds and delivers on visions for segment (this may encompass a range of projects to achieve a larger goal) that clearly communicates a larger strategy in approach to implementation with minimal supervision.
â€¢ Able to clearly express, train and drive team/segment vision goals.
â€¢ Provides effective production support including accurate problem identification, ticket documentation, and customer/vendor dialogue.
â€¢ Dissects complex situations and refocuses on critical technology tasks.
â€¢ Extensive experience in identifying, verifying, vetting, and testing hardware/software requirements for proposed automation and orchestrations solutions.
â€¢ Identifies and pursues learning and upskilling opportunities relevant to technologies, products and needs anticipated within their technical space.
â€¢ Other duties as assigned.
